subject: Entrepreneurship
title: What Is an MVP?
description: A fast breakdown of What Is an MVP? for builders.

hook.text: The minimum viable product is the most misunderstood idea in startup culture.

buildup.text: Many founders think MVP means a cheap, ugly version of their dream product. That's not it.

discovery.text: An MVP is the fastest experiment that lets you test your riskiest assumption with real customers.

twist.text: Sometimes an MVP isn't even a product. Dropbox's MVP was a three-minute video. That's it.

climax.text: The video got 75,000 signups overnight. It proved demand existed without writing a single line of code.

punchline.text: An MVP isn't a small product. It's a big question.

quiz.question: What was Dropbox's minimum viable product?
options: A basic file-syncing tool with limited storage
A three-minute video demonstrating the concept
A landing page with a signup form
